briefdescription.para: Create a new instance of SoundTouch processor.

detaileddescription.para: Get SoundTouch library version string - alternative function for environments that can't properly handle character string as return value
Sets new rate control value. Normal rate = 1.0, smaller values represent slower rate, larger faster rates.
Sets new tempo control value. Normal tempo = 1.0, smaller values represent slower tempo, larger faster tempo.
Sets new rate control value as a difference in percents compared to the original rate (-50 .. +100 %)
Sets new tempo control value as a difference in percents compared to the original tempo (-50 .. +100 %)
Sets new pitch control value. Original pitch = 1.0, smaller values represent lower pitches, larger values higher pitch.
Sets pitch change in octaves compared to the original pitch (-1.00 .. +1.00)
Sets pitch change in semi-tones compared to the original pitch (-12 .. +12)

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of channels, 1 = mono, 2 = stereo.

detaileddescription.para: Flushes the last samples from the processing pipeline to the output. Clears also the internal processing buffers. Note: This function is meant for extracting the last samples of a sound stream. This function may introduce additional blank samples in the end of the sound stream, and thus it's not recommended to call this function in the middle of a sound stream.

briefdescription.para: Number of samples in buffer. Notice that in case of stereo-sound a single sample contains data for both channels.

detaileddescription.para: Adds 'numSamples' pcs of samples from the 'samples' memory position into the input of the object. Notice that sample rate has_to be set before calling this function, otherwise throws a runtime_error exception.
Clears all the samples in the object's output and internal processing buffers.

briefdescription.para: Setting ID number. see SETTING_... defines.

detaileddescription.para: Changes a setting controlling the processing system behaviour. See the 'SETTING_...' defines for available setting ID's.

simplesect.para: 'TRUE' if the setting was succesfully changed

briefdescription.para: Setting ID number, see SETTING_... defines.

detaileddescription.para: Reads a setting controlling the processing system behaviour. See the 'SETTING_...' defines for available setting ID's.

briefdescription.para: Returns number of samples currently unprocessed.
Buffer where to copy output samples.
How many samples to receive at max.

detaileddescription.para: Adjusts book-keeping so that given number of samples are removed from beginning of the sample buffer without copying them anywhere.
Used to reduce the number of samples in the buffer when accessing the sample buffer directly with 'ptrBegin' function.

briefdescription.para: Returns number of samples currently available.
Returns nonzero if there aren't any samples available for outputting.
